episodeTitle: Believe in Miracles! Bon Clay's Cries from the Heart!
episodeTitleJapanese: 奇跡を信じて！ボン・クレー魂の声援
episodeTitleRomanized: Kiseki o Shinjite! Bon Kurē Tamashī no Seien
description: Bentham learns that Ivankov has hormone-controlling powers and discovers New Kama Land exists between Level 5 and Level 6. While Luffy undergoes Ivankov's healing treatment, Bon Clay refuses to give up hope and cheers for his friend's recovery. Against all odds, Luffy miraculously recovers much faster than expected, but Ace's execution looms just hours away.

events.title: Ivankov's Horm-Horm Fruit Abilities Explained
events.description: Ivankov explains to Bentham that he ate the Horm-Horm Fruit (Horu Horu no Mi), which allows him to control and inject hormones into people, changing their skin color, body temperature, sex, and other physical attributes. This reveals the full extent of his Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: First detailed explanation of Ivankov's hormone-controlling abilities and how they can be used for healing and transformation.

quotes.text: I ate the Horm-Horm Fruit so I can alter a person's hormones, changing their skin, temperature and sex.
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Explaining his Devil Fruit abilities to Bon Clay

events.title: New Kama Land's Origin Revealed
events.description: Ivankov reveals that New Kama Land (Level 5.5) exists between Level 5 and Level 6 of Impel Down, and was built by a prisoner who had tunneling abilities. This hidden sanctuary has been unknown to the prison authorities.
events.significance: Explains the mysterious origin of the secret level and how prisoners have been able to disappear from Impel Down records.

events.title: Level 6 Prisoners Revealed
events.description: Bon Clay learns that Crocodile, Ace, and Jinbe are all being held in Level 6 of Impel Down - the deepest level known as Eternal Hell where the most dangerous criminals are imprisoned. This reveals that there are prisoners so dangerous their very existence is hidden from the world.
events.significance: Establishes the severity of Level 6 and confirms the locations of several major characters, setting up future rescue attempts.

events.title: Shiryu's Background Revealed in Flashback
events.description: In a flashback, Ivankov reveals that Shiryu of the Rain was once the Head Jailer of Impel Down but was imprisoned in Level 6 for his bloodlust. He would kill prisoners indiscriminately, which concerned Magellan and led to his imprisonment.
events.significance: Introduces Shiryu as a major threat and establishes his violent nature and history with Impel Down.

events.title: Race Against Time for Ace's Execution
events.description: Ivankov tells Bon Clay that Luffy's treatment will take at least three days to complete, but Ace's execution is scheduled to happen in just a matter of hours. This creates a seemingly impossible situation where Luffy cannot possibly save his brother in time.
events.significance: Establishes the central dramatic tension and time pressure that drives the rest of the Impel Down arc and leads into Marineford.

quotes.text: Luffy will fully recover in three days and by that time Ace will have already been executed.
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Explaining the impossible timeline to Bon Clay

events.title: Bon Clay's Unwavering Loyalty Begins
events.description: Despite being told that Luffy's survival is unlikely and that even if he survives he won't be able to save Ace, Bon Clay refuses to give up hope. He stays by the treatment room door and begins cheering for Luffy to fight and survive.
events.significance: Demonstrates Bon Clay's incredible loyalty and friendship with Luffy, showcasing one of the series' core themes about the power of friendship and belief.

quotes.text: I believe in miracles! Luffy, you can do it!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Beginning his vigil outside Luffy's treatment room

events.title: Luffy's Agonized Screams During Treatment
events.description: Luffy screams in extreme agony as Ivankov's healing hormones battle Magellan's poison inside his body. The treatment causes him incredible pain as his body fights to survive the deadly toxins.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's incredible willpower and determination to survive, emphasizing the severity of Magellan's poison and the miraculous nature of his recovery.

events.title: Bon Clay's Ten-Hour Vigil
events.description: For ten straight hours, Bon Clay stands outside the treatment room cheering for Luffy, refusing to leave his side despite his own exhaustion. He bangs on the door and screams encouragement, not wanting to lose his friend.
events.significance: One of the most emotional displays of friendship in One Piece, showing Bon Clay's selfless devotion to Luffy.

events.title: New Kama Residents Join the Cheering
events.description: Moved by Bon Clay's unwavering dedication and friendship, all the New Kama Land residents begin cheering for Luffy alongside Bon Clay. Ivankov also joins in, creating a chorus of support for Luffy's recovery.
events.significance: Demonstrates the power of hope and collective belief, showing how one person's conviction can inspire others.

events.title: Luffy's Miraculous Recovery
events.description: Against all medical expectations, Luffy's screams suddenly stop. After a moment of silence where everyone fears the worst, Luffy bangs on the door and screams that he's hungry and has recovered. The 'miracle' that Bon Clay believed in has happened - Luffy survived and recovered in less than a day instead of three.
events.significance: Major turning point that allows the Impel Down breakout to continue. Demonstrates Luffy's superhuman willpower and the power of belief. Also shows the strength of the bonds of friendship.

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Announcing his miraculous recovery to everyone's shock

events.title: Pandaman Cameo Among the Newkamas
events.description: After Luffy's recovery, Pandaman makes a brief cameo appearance among the celebrating New Kama Land residents.
events.significance: A fun Easter egg and recurring gag character appearance for eagle-eyed fans to spot.

events.title: Ace and Jinbe's Conversation in Level 6
events.description: In Level 6, Ace talks with Jinbe about Luffy, expressing concern about his younger brother's reckless nature while imprisoned and awaiting execution.
events.significance: Shows Ace's brotherly concern for Luffy even while facing his own execution, reinforcing their bond.

themes.description: The episode powerfully demonstrates Bon Clay's unwavering friendship with Luffy, refusing to give up hope even when told survival is nearly impossible.
themes.symbolism: Bon Clay's ten-hour vigil represents the power of belief and loyalty in friendship, ultimately contributing to Luffy's miraculous recovery.

themes.description: Luffy's impossible recovery showcases the series' theme that willpower and determination can overcome seemingly insurmountable odds.
themes.symbolism: The collective cheering of the New Kama residents symbolizes how shared belief and support can manifest miracles.

themes.description: The ticking clock toward Ace's execution creates intense pressure and dramatic tension, forcing characters to make difficult choices.
themes.symbolism: The countdown represents the inevitability of loss and the desperate struggle to prevent it.

characterSpotlights.development: Bon Clay's character reaches new emotional heights as he demonstrates the true depth of his friendship with Luffy, staying by his side for ten hours and never losing hope.
keyActions: Learns about Ivankov's Devil Fruit powers and New Kama Land's origins
Discovers that Ace, Crocodile, and Jinbe are in Level 6
Refuses to give up hope despite being told Luffy's survival is unlikely
Cheers for Luffy continuously for ten hours
Inspires the entire New Kama Land community to join in supporting Luffy
quotes: I believe in miracles! Luffy, you can do it!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his incredible willpower by surviving impossible odds and recovering from Magellan's deadly poison in record time.
keyActions: Endures ten hours of agonizing treatment
Miraculously recovers in less than a day instead of three
Shows determination to continue his mission to save Ace

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov reveals the full extent of his Devil Fruit powers and shows his compassionate side by treating Luffy and being moved by Bon Clay's loyalty.
keyActions: Explains his Horm-Horm Fruit abilities in detail
Reveals information about New Kama Land's creation and Level 6 prisoners
Treats Luffy with healing hormones despite slim chances of survival
Joins the New Kama residents in cheering for Luffy
quotes: I ate the Horm-Horm Fruit so I can alter a person's hormones, changing their skin, temperature and sex.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scenes of Bon Clay cheering for Luffy and the emotional impact of his vigil, adding more dramatic emphasis than the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to feature Jinbe's new voice actor Katsuhisa Hōki in Japanese, following the tragic death of original voice actor Daisuke Gōri on January 17, 2010.
Pandaman makes a cameo appearance among the New Kama Land residents after Luffy's recovery, continuing the series' long-running Easter egg tradition.
Shiryu's first appearance is in a flashback in this episode, though he appears in person in Episode 444.
The episode adapts content from manga chapters 538 (pages 8-19) and 539 (pages 2-4).
This episode's title directly references the theme of belief and miracles, which becomes a reality when Luffy recovers far faster than medically possible.
